tags.name: fix-number
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - fixNumber

 Usage: 
 ```html

</ANY> 
 ```

 ```html 
</ANY> 
 ```

tags.name: umb-button
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbButton 

 Use this directive to render an umbraco button. The directive can be used to generate all types of buttons, set type, style, translation, shortcut and much more.


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-button
       action="{callback}"
       [href="{string}"]
       [type="{string}"]
       [button-style="{string}"]
       [state="{string}"]
       [shortcut="{string}"]
       [label="{string}"]
       [label-key="{string}"]
       [icon="{string}"]
       [size="{string}"]
       [disabled]
       [add-ellipsis="{boolean}"]
       [show-caret="{boolean}"]
       [auto-focus="{boolean}"]
       [has-popup="{boolean}"]
       [is-expanded="{boolean}"]>
</umb-button> 
 ```

attributes.name: action
attributes.description:
The button action which should be performed when the button is clicked.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Url/Path to navigato to. (requires type to be set to link)

Type: `string`

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the button type (button, link, submit).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: button-style
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the style of the button. The directive uses the default bootstrap styles (primary, info, success, warning, danger, inverse, link, block). Pass in array to add multple styles [success,block].

Type: `string`

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a progress state on the button (init, busy, success, error).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: shortcut
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a keyboard shortcut for the button (ctrl+c).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the button label.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label-key
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a localization key to make a multi-lingual button (general_buttonText).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a button icon.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a button size (xs, m, l, xl).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set to true to disable the button.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: add-ellipsis
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Adds an ellipsis character (â¦) to the button label which means the button will open a dialog or prompt the user for more information.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: show-caret
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Shows a caret on the right side of the button label

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: auto-focus
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ add autoFocus to the button

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: has-popup
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Used to expose to the accessibility API whether the button will trigger a popup or not

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: is-expanded
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Used to add an aria-expanded attribute and expose whether the button controls collapsible content

Type: `boolean`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-button`

tags.name: umb-button-ellipsis
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbButtonEllipsis 

 Added in Umbraco version 8.7.0 Use this directive to render an umbraco ellipsis.

 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-button-ellipsis
       action="{callback}"
       text="{string}"
       [label-key="{string}"]
       [css-class="{string}"]
       [color="{string}"]
       [show-text="{boolean}"]
       [element="{string}"]
       [state="{string}"]
       [mode="{string}"]>
</umb-button-ellipsis> 
 ```

attributes.name: action
attributes.description:
Callback when the value of the checkbox changes through interaction.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: text
attributes.description:
Set the text for the checkbox label.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label-key
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a dictionary/localization string for the checkbox label

Type: `string`

attributes.name: css-class
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a css class modifier

Type: `string`

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a hex code e.g. #f5c1bc. #000000 by default

Type: `string`

attributes.name: show-text
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set to true to show the text. false by default

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: element
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Highlights a DOM-element (HTML selector) e.g. my-div-name

Type: `string`

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the initial state of the component. To have it hidden use hidden

Type: `string`

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the mode, which decides how to style the component. small and tab are currently supported

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-button-ellipsis`

tags.name: umb-button-group
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbButtonGroup 

 Use this directive to render a button with a dropdown of alternative actions.



 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-button-group
       default-button="{object}"

</umb-button-group>
 ```

attributes.name: defaultButton

attributes.name: subButtons

Array of sub buttons.

Type: `array`

attributes.name: state
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a progress state on the button (init, busy, success, error).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the direction of the dropdown (up, down).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: float
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set the float of the dropdown. (left, right).

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-button-group`

tags.name: umb-checkbox
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbCheckbox 

 Added in Umbraco version 7.14.0 Use this directive to render an umbraco checkbox.

 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-checkbox
       model="{boolean}"
       input-id="{string}"
       value="{string}"
       name="{string}"
       text="{string}"
       label-key="{string}"
       server-validation-field="{string}"
       disabled
       required
       on-change="{callback}"
       css-class="{string}"
       icon="{string}"
       disable-dirty-check="{boolean}">
</umb-checkbox> 
 ```

attributes.name: model
attributes.description:
Set to true or false to set the checkbox to checked or unchecked.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: inputId
attributes.description:
Set the id of the checkbox.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Set the value of the checkbox.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
Set the name of the checkbox.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: text
attributes.description:
Set the text for the checkbox label.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: labelKey
attributes.description:
Set a dictinary/localization string for the checkbox label

Type: `string`

attributes.name: serverValidationField
attributes.description:
Set the val-server-field of the checkbox.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Set the checkbox to be disabled.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Set the checkbox to be required.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
Callback when the value of the checkbox change by interaction.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: cssClass
attributes.description:
Set a css class modifier.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Set an icon next to checkbox.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: disableDirtyCheck
attributes.description:
Disable checking if the model is dirty.

Type: `boolean`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-checkbox`

tags.name: umb-child-selector
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbChildSelector 

 Use this directive to render a ui component for selecting child items to a parent node.


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-child-selector
       selected-children="{array}"
       available-children="{array}"
       parent-name="{string}"
       parent-icon="{string}"
       parent-id="{number}"
       on-remove="{callback}"
       on-add="{callback}"
       on-sort="{callback}">
</umb-child-selector> 
 ```

attributes.name: selectedChildren
attributes.description:
Array of selected children.

Type: `array`

attributes.name: availableChildren
attributes.description:
(binding: Array of items available for selection.

Type: `array`

attributes.name: parentName
attributes.description:
The parent name.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: parentIcon
attributes.description:
The parent icon.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: parentId
attributes.description:
The parent id.

Type: `number`

attributes.name: onRemove
attributes.description:
Callback when removing an item.
The callback returns:

    child: The selected item.
    $index: The selected item index.


Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onAdd
attributes.description:
Callback when adding an item.
The callback returns:

    $event: The select event.


Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onSort
attributes.description:
Callback when sorting an item.
The callback returns:

    $event: The select event.


Type: `callback`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-child-selector`

tags.name: umb-clipboard

attributes.name: umbClipboardSuccess

attributes.name: umbClipboardTarget
attributes.description:
The target element to copy.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: umbClipboardAction
attributes.description:
Specify if you want to copy or cut content (copy, cut). Cut only works on input and textarea elements.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: umbClipboardText
attributes.description:
Use this attribute if you don't have an element to copy from.

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-clipboard`

attributes.name: onShow

attributes.name: onHide

attributes.name: onMove

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-confirm`

tags.name: umb-confirm-action
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbConfirmAction 

 Use this directive to toggle a confirmation prompt for an action.
The prompt consists of a checkmark and a cross to confirm or cancel the action.
The prompt can be opened in four direction up, down, left or right.


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-confirm-action
       direction="{string}"
       on-confirm="{callback}"
       on-cancel="{callback}">
</umb-confirm-action> 
 ```

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description:
The direction the prompt opens (up, down, left, right).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: onConfirm
attributes.description:
Callback when the checkmark is clicked.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onCancel
attributes.description:
Callback when the cross is clicked.

Type: `callback`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-confirm-action`

tags.name: umb-content-grid
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbContentGrid 

 Use this directive to generate a list of content items presented as a flexbox grid.


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-content-grid
       content="{array}"
       [content-properties="{array}"]
       [on-click="{callback}"]
       [on-click-name="{callback}"]>
</umb-content-grid> 
 ```

attributes.name: content
attributes.description:
Array of content items.

Type: `array`

attributes.name: content-properties
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Array of content item properties to include in the item. If left empty the item will only show the item icon and name.

Type: `array`

attributes.name: on-click
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Callback method to handle click events on the content item.
The callback returns:

    item: The clicked item
    $event: The select event
    $index: The item index


Type: `callback`

attributes.name: on-click-name
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Callback method to handle click events on the checkmark icon.
The callback returns:

    item: The selected item
    $event: The select event
    $index: The item index


Type: `callback`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-content-grid`

tags.name: umb-date-time-picker
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbDateTimePicker 

 Added in Umbraco version 8.0
This directive is a wrapper of the flatpickr library. Use it to render a date time picker.
For extra details about options and events take a look here: https://flatpickr.js.org
Use this directive to render a date time picker


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-date-time-picker
       ng-model="{object}"
       options="{object}"
       on-setup="{callback}"
       on-change="{callback}"
       on-open="{callback}"
       on-close="{callback}"
       on-month-change="{callback}"
       on-year-change="{callback}"
       on-ready="{callback}"
       on-value-update="{callback}"
       on-day-create="{callback}">
</umb-date-time-picker> 
 ```

attributes.name: ngModel
attributes.description:
Config object for the date picker.

Type: `object`

attributes.name: options
attributes.description:
Config object for the date picker.

Type: `object`

attributes.name: onSetup
attributes.description:
onSetup gets triggered when the date picker is initialized

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
onChange gets triggered when the user selects a date, or changes the time on a selected date.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onOpen

attributes.name: description-locked

attributes.name: hide-description

Type: `string`

attributes.name: enable-lock
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set to true to add a lock next to the alias from where it can be unlocked and changed.

 ```html 
 <umb-progress-circle

</umb-progress-circle>
 ```

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
This parameter defines the width and the height of the circle in pixels.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: percentage
attributes.description:
Takes a number between 0 and 100 and applies it to the circle's highlight length.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color of the highlight (primary, secondary, success, warning, danger). Success by default.

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-progress-circle`

tags.name: umb-radiobutton
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbRadiobutton 

 Added in Umbraco version 7.14.0 Use this directive to render an umbraco radio button.

 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-radiobutton
       model="{boolean}"
       input-id="{string}"
       value="{string}"
       name="{string}"
       text="{string}"
       label-key="{string}"
       server-validation-field="{string}"
       disabled
       required
       on-change="{callback}"
       css-class="{string}"
       icon-class="{string}"
       disable-dirty-check="{boolean}">
</umb-radiobutton> 
 ```

attributes.name: model
attributes.description:
Set to true or false to set the radiobutton to checked or unchecked.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: inputId
attributes.description:
Set the id of the radiobutton.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Set the value of the radiobutton.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
Set the name of the radiobutton.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: text
attributes.description:
Set the text for the radiobutton label.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: labelKey
attributes.description:
Set a dictinary/localization string for the checkbox label.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: serverValidationField
attributes.description:
Set the val-server-field of the radiobutton.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Set the radiobutton to be disabled.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Set the radiobutton to be required.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
Callback when the value of the radiobutton change by interaction.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: cssClass
attributes.description:
Set a css class modifier.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: iconClass
attributes.description:
Set an icon next to radiobutton.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: disableDirtyCheck
attributes.description:
Disable checking if the model is dirty.

Type: `boolean`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-radiobutton`

tags.name: umb-range-slider
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbRangeSlider 

 Added in Umbraco version 8.0
This directive is a wrapper of the noUiSlider library. Use it to render a slider.
For extra details about options and events take a look here: https://refreshless.com/nouislider/


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-range-slider
       ng-model="{object}"
       options="{object}"
       on-setup="{callback}"
       on-update="{callback}"
       on-slide="{callback}"
       on-set="{callback}"
       on-change="{callback}"
       on-start="{callback}"
       on-end="{callback}">
</umb-range-slider> 
 ```

attributes.name: ngModel
attributes.description:
Value for the slider.

Type: `object`

attributes.name: options
attributes.description:
Config object for the slider.

Type: `object`

attributes.name: onSetup
attributes.description:
onSetup gets triggered when the slider is initialized

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onUpdate
attributes.description:
onUpdate fires every time the slider values are changed.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onSlide
attributes.description:
onSlide gets triggered when the handle is being dragged.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onSet
attributes.description:
onSet will trigger every time a slider stops changing.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onChange
attributes.description:
onChange fires when a user stops sliding, or when a slider value is changed by 'tap'.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onStart
attributes.description:
onStart fires when a handle is clicked (mousedown, or the equivalent touch events).

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: onEnd
attributes.description:
onEnd fires when a handle is released (mouseup etc), or when a slide is canceled due to other reasons.

Type: `callback`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-range-slider`

tags.name: umb-toggle
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbToggle 

 Added in Umbraco version 7.7.0 Use this directive to render an umbraco toggle.


 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-toggle
       checked
       input-id="{string}"
       on-click="{callback}"
       [show-labels="{string}"]
       [label-on="{string}"]
       [label-off="{string}"]
       [label-position="{string}"]
       [hide-icons="{string}"]>
</umb-toggle> 
 ```

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description:
Set to true or false to toggle the switch.

Type: `boolean`

attributes.name: inputId
attributes.description:
Set the id of the toggle.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: onClick
attributes.description:
The function which should be called when the toggle is clicked.

Type: `callback`

attributes.name: show-labels
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set to true or false to show a On or Off label next to the switch.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label-on
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a custom label for when the switched is turned on. It will default to On.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label-off
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set a custom label for when the switched is turned off. It will default to Off.

Type: `string`

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Sets the label position to the left or right of the switch. It will default to left (left, right).

Type: `string`

attributes.name: hide-icons
attributes.description:
_(optional)_ Set to true or false to hide the icons on the switch.

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-toggle`

tags.name: umb-tour
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbTour 

 Added in Umbraco 7.8. The tour component is a global component and is already added to the umbraco markup.
In the Umbraco UI the tours live in the "Help drawer" which opens when you click the Help-icon in the bottom left corner of Umbraco.
You can easily add you own tours to the Help-drawer or show and start tours from
anywhere in the Umbraco backoffice. To see a real world example of a custom tour implementation, install The Starter Kit in Umbraco 7.8










 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-tour
       model="{string}">
</umb-tour> 
 ```

attributes.name: model
attributes.description:
Tour object

Type: `string`

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `umb-tour`

tags.name: umb-user-group-preview
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - umbUserGroupPreview 

 Use this directive to render a user group preview, where you can see the permissions the user or group has in the back office.

 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <umb-user-group-preview
       icon="{string}"
       name="{string}"
       sections="{array}"
       content-start-node="{string}"
       hide-content-start-node="{boolean}"
       media-start-node="{string}"
 ```

 The starting point in the tree of the media section.
 So the user has no authority to work on other branches, only on this branch in the media section.

tags.name: val-form-manager
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valFormManager 

 Used to broadcast an event to all elements inside this one to notify that form validation has
changed. If we don't use this that means you have to put a watch for each directive on a form's validation
changing which would result in much higher processing. We need to actually watch the whole $error collection of a form
because just watching $valid or $invalid doesn't acurrately trigger form validation changing.
This also sets the show-validation (or a custom) css class on the element when the form is invalid - this lets
us css target elements to be displayed when the form is submitting/submitted.
Another thing this directive does is to ensure that any .control-group that contains form elements that are invalid will
be marked with the 'error' css class. This ensures that labels included in that control group are styled correctly.
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-form-manager>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-form-manager`

tags.name: val-highlight
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valHighlight 

 Used on input fields when you want to signal that they are in error, this will highlight the item for 1 second
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-highlight>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-highlight`

tags.name: val-property-msg
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valPropertyMsg 

 This directive is used to control the display of the property level validation message.
We will listen for server side validation changes
and when an error is detected for this property we'll show the error message.
In order for this directive to work, the valFormManager directive must be placed on the containing form.
We don't set the validity of this validator to false when client side validation fails, only when server side
validation fails however we do respond to the client side validation changes to display error and adjust UI state.
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <textarea val-property-msg>
   ...
</textarea> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-property-msg`

tags.name: val-property-validator
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valPropertyValidator 

 Performs any custom property value validation checks on the client side. This allows property editors to be highly flexible when it comes to validation
on the client side. Typically if a property editor stores a primitive value (i.e. string) then the client side validation can easily be taken care of 
with standard angular directives such as ng-required. However since some property editors store complex data such as JSON, a given property editor
might require custom validation. This directive can be used to validate an Umbraco property in any way that a developer would like by specifying a
callback method to perform the validation. The result of this method must return an object in the format of 
{isValid: true, errorKey: 'required', errorMsg: 'Something went wrong' }
The error message returned will also be displayed for the property level validation message.
This directive should only be used when dealing with complex models, if custom validation needs to be performed with primitive values, use the simpler 
angular validation directives instead since this will watch the entire model. 
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-property-validator>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-property-validator`

tags.name: val-regex
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valRegex 

 A custom directive to allow for matching a value against a regex string.
NOTE: there's already an ng-pattern but this requires that a regex expression is set, not a regex string
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-regex>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-regex`

tags.name: val-server
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valServer 

 This directive is used to associate a content property with a server-side validation response
so that the validators in angular are updated based on server-side feedback.
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-server>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-server`

tags.name: val-server-field
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valServerField 

 This directive is used to associate a field with a server-side validation response
so that the validators in angular are updated based on server-side feedback.
(For validation of user defined content properties on content/media/members, the valServer directive is used)
 
 Usage: 
 ```html

   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-server-field`

tags.name: val-server-match
tags.description:
#### Umbraco - valServerMatch 

 A custom validator applied to a form/ng-form within an umbProperty that validates server side validation data
contained within the serverValidationManager. The data can be matched on "exact", "prefix", "suffix" or "contains" matches against 
a property validation key. The attribute value can be in multiple value types:
 
 Usage: 
 ```html 
 <ANY val-server-match>
   ...
</ANY> 
 ```

references.name: Umbraco API Docs V8 > Umbraco directive `val-server-match`

tags.name: val-sub-view
tags.description:

 Used to show validation warnings for a editor sub view (used in conjunction with:
umb-editor-sub-view or umb-editor-sub-views) to indicate that the section content has validation errors in its data.
In order for this directive to work, the valFormManager directive must be placed on the containing form.
When applied to
